executive_summary.business_context: Acme Corp is a SaaS provider specializing in HR management solutions for mid-sized enterprises. Security of client and employee data is a top priority due to the sensitive nature of the information processed.
executive_summary.security_state: The organization has established foundational security controls but faces gaps in access management, monitoring, and documentation. Stakeholders include executive leadership, IT, HR, and compliance officers.
executive_summary.summary_of_findings: The audit identified several non-conformities and opportunities for improvement, primarily related to access controls, incident response documentation, and periodic risk assessments.

requirements.title: Logical Access Controls
requirements.description: Controls to restrict logical access to system resources and data to authorized users.

requirements.title: User Access Reviews
requirements.description: Controls to review user access rights at regular intervals.

requirements.title: Incident Response
requirements.description: Controls to ensure timely response to identified security incidents.

findings.title: Unauthorized Access to Sensitive Data
findings.description: User access controls are not consistently enforced on the HR system, allowing unauthorized staff to view sensitive employee records.

findings.title: Lack of Incident Response Plan
findings.description: There is no documented incident response plan, which may delay or hinder effective response to security incidents.

activities.title: Implement Quarterly Access Reviews
activities.definition: Establish a process to review and update user access rights to all sensitive systems every quarter.
activities.context_specific_explanation: Given Acme Corpâ€™s high staff turnover, frequent reviews are necessary to minimize risk.
activities.definition_of_done: Documented evidence of quarterly reviews and removal of unnecessary access.
activities.soc2_relevance: Directly addresses SOC 2 CC6.1 and CC6.2 requirements for logical access controls.

activities.title: Enforce Role-Based Access Controls
activities.definition: Configure HR system permissions to ensure only authorized roles can access sensitive data.
activities.context_specific_explanation: Prevents unauthorized access and supports least privilege principle.
activities.definition_of_done: Access logs show only authorized users accessing sensitive records.

activities.title: Develop and Document Incident Response Plan
activities.definition: Create a formal incident response plan and train staff on procedures.
activities.context_specific_explanation: Ensures preparedness for security incidents and regulatory compliance.
activities.definition_of_done: Incident response plan approved and distributed; training completed.
activities.soc2_relevance: Addresses SOC 2 CC7.2 requirement for incident response.

documents.title: HR Access Policy.pdf
documents.summary: Outlines procedures for granting and revoking access to HR systems.

documents.title: System Access Logs.csv
documents.summary: Exported logs showing user access to HR system over the past year.

documents.title: Security Policies Handbook.pdf
documents.summary: Comprehensive set of security policies, missing incident response section.

interviews.subject: IT Security Manager
interviews.notes: Confirmed lack of regular access reviews and difficulties in tracking user permissions.

interviews.subject: Compliance Officer
interviews.notes: Acknowledged absence of a formal incident response plan and intent to prioritize its development.
